trans-unit.source: Represents the statement of a <xref href="System.Security.Policy.CodeGroup"></xref> describing the permissions and other information that apply to code with a particular set of evidence.
This class cannot be inherited.
A <xref:System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement> consists of a set of granted permissions, and possible special attributes for the code group.
Policy statements are typically used as the return value of a <xref:System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel.Resolve%2A> operation on a <xref:System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Security.PermissionSet"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Security.PermissionSet"></xref> with which to initialize the new instance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Security.PermissionSet"></xref> and attributes.
The <xref href="System.Security.PermissionSet"></xref> with which to initialize the new instance.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatementAttribute"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the attributes of the policy statement.
The attributes of the policy statement.
Gets a string representation of the attributes of the policy statement.
Use this property to get a text string of the attributes currently set for the <xref:System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement>.
A text string representing the attributes of the policy statement.
Creates an equivalent copy of the current policy statement.

A new copy of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement"></xref> with <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement.PermissionSet"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement.Attributes"></xref> identical to those of the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement"></xref>.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement"></xref> object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement"></xref>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement"></xref> object to compare with the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement"></xref>.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement"></xref> object; otherwise, `false`.
Reconstructs a security object with a given state from an XML encoding.
The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
The et parameter is `null`.
The et parameter is not a valid encoding.
Reconstructs a security object with a given state from an XML encoding.
The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel"></xref> context for lookup of <xref href="System.Security.NamedPermissionSet"></xref> values.
The et parameter is `null`.
The et parameter is not a valid encoding.
Gets a hash code for the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement"></xref> object that is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.
The hash code for two instances of the same permission might be different, hence a hash code should not be used to compare two <xref:System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement> objects.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Security.PermissionSet"></xref> of the policy statement.
The <xref href="System.Security.PermissionSet"></xref> of the policy statement.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.
An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel"></xref> context for lookup of <xref href="System.Security.NamedPermissionSet"></xref> values.
An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
